t: Nehemiah 9
The People Confess Their Sin
Now*p on the twenty-fourth day of this month the sons of Israel assembled with fasting, in sackcloth and with dirt upon them.
The descendants of Israel separated themselves from all foreigners, and stood and confessed their sins and the iniquities of their fathers.
While they stood in their place, they read from the book of the law of the Lord*s their God for a fourth of the day; and for another*i fourth they confessed and worshiped the Lord*s their God.
Now on the Levites’ platform stood Jeshua, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani and*i Chenani, and they cried with a loud voice to the Lord*s their God.

Then*p the Levites, Jeshua, Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabneiah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah and*i Pethahiah, said, “Arise, bless the Lord*s your God forever and ever! O*pn may Your glorious name be blessed And*ln exalted above all blessing and praise!

You*ln alone are the Lord.*s You*ln have made the heavens, The*ln heaven of heavens with all their host, The*ln earth and all that is on it, The*ln seas and all that is in them. You*ln give life to all of them And*ln the heavenly host bows down before You.
You*ln are the Lord*s God, Who*ln chose Abram And*ln brought him out from Ur of the Chaldees, And*ln gave him the name Abraham.

You*ln found his heart faithful before You, And*ln made a covenant with him To*ln give him*i the land of the Canaanite, Of*ln the Hittite and the Amorite, Of*ln the Perizzite, the Jebusite and the Girgashite— To*ln give it*i to his descendants. And*ln You have fulfilled Your promise, For*ln You are righteous.
“You*ln saw the affliction of our fathers in Egypt, And*ln heard their cry by the Red Sea.

Then*ln You performed signs and wonders against Pharaoh, Against*ln all his servants and all the people of his land; For*ln You knew that they acted arrogantly toward them, And*ln made a name for Yourself as it*i is*i this day.
You*ln divided the sea before them, So*ln they passed through the midst of the sea on dry ground; And*ln their pursuers You hurled into the depths, Like*ln a stone into raging waters.
And*ln with a pillar of cloud You led them by day, And*ln with a pillar of fire by night To*ln light for them the way In*ln which they were to go.
Then*ln You came down on Mount Sinai, And*ln spoke with them from heaven; You*ln gave them just ordinances and true laws, Good*ln statutes and commandments.
So*ln You made known to them Your holy sabbath, And*ln laid down for them commandments, statutes and law, Through*ln Your servant Moses.

You*ln provided bread from heaven for them for their hunger, You*ln brought forth water from a rock for them for their thirst, And*ln You told them to enter in order to possess The*ln land which You swore to give them.
“But*ln they, our fathers, acted arrogantly; They*ln became stubborn and would not listen to Your commandments.

They*ln refused to listen, And*ln did not remember Your wondrous deeds which You had performed among them; So*ln they became stubborn and appointed a leader to return to their slavery in Egypt. But*ln You are a God of forgiveness, Gracious*ln and compassionate, Slow*ln to anger and abounding in lovingkindness; And*ln You did not forsake them.
Even*ln when they made for themselves A*ln calf of molten metal And*ln said, ‘This is your God Who*ln brought you up from Egypt,’ And*ln committed great blasphemies,

You,*ln in Your great compassion, Did*ln not forsake them in the wilderness; The*ln pillar of cloud did not leave them by day, To*ln guide them on their way, Nor*ln the pillar of fire by night, to light for them the way in which they were to go.
You*ln gave Your good Spirit to instruct them, Your*ln manna You did not withhold from their mouth, And*ln You gave them water for their thirst.
Indeed,*ln forty years You provided for them in the wilderness and*i they were not in want; Their*ln clothes did not wear out, nor did their feet swell.
You*ln also gave them kingdoms and peoples, And*ln allotted them*i to them as a boundary. They*ln took possession of the land of Sihon the king of Heshbon And*ln the land of Og the king of Bashan.
You*ln made their sons numerous as the stars of heaven, And*ln You brought them into the land Which*ln You had told their fathers to enter and possess.

So*ln their sons entered and possessed the land. And*ln You subdued before them the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, And*ln You gave them into their hand, with their kings and the peoples of the land, To*ln do with them as they desired.

They*ln captured fortified cities and a fertile land. They*ln took possession of houses full of every good thing, Hewn*ln cisterns, vineyards, olive groves, Fruit*ln trees in abundance. So*ln they ate, were filled and grew fat, And*ln reveled in Your great goodness.

“But*ln they became disobedient and rebelled against You, And*ln cast Your law behind their backs And*ln killed Your prophets who had admonished them So*ln that they might return to You, And*ln they committed great blasphemies.

Therefore*ln You delivered them into the hand of their oppressors who oppressed them, But*ln when they cried to You in the time of their distress, You*ln heard from heaven, and according to Your great compassion You*ln gave them deliverers who delivered them from the hand of their oppressors.

But*ln as soon as they had rest, they did evil again before You; Therefore*ln You abandoned them to the hand of their enemies, so that they ruled over them. When*ln they cried again to You, You heard from heaven, And*ln many times You rescued them according to Your compassion,

And*ln admonished them in order to turn them back to Your law. Yet*ln they acted arrogantly and did not listen to Your commandments but sinned against Your ordinances, By*ln which if a man observes them he shall live. And*ln they turned a stubborn shoulder and stiffened their neck, and would not listen.

However,*ln You bore with them for many years, And*ln admonished them by Your Spirit through Your prophets, Yet*ln they would not give ear. Therefore*ln You gave them into the hand of the peoples of the lands.
Nevertheless,*ln in Your great compassion You did not make an end of them or forsake them, For*ln You are a gracious and compassionate God.

“Now*ln therefore, our God, the great, the mighty, and the awesome God, who keeps covenant and lovingkindness, Do*ln not let all the hardship seem insignificant before You, Which*ln has come upon us, our kings, our princes, our priests, our prophets, our fathers and on all Your people, From*ln the days of the kings of Assyria to this day.
However,*ln You are just in all that has come upon us; For*ln You have dealt faithfully, but we have acted wickedly.
For*ln our kings, our leaders, our priests and our fathers have not kept Your law Or*ln paid attention to Your commandments and Your admonitions with which You have admonished them.
But*ln they, in their own kingdom, With*ln Your great goodness which You gave them, With*ln the broad and rich land which You set before them, Did*ln not serve You or turn from their evil deeds.
Behold,*ln we are slaves today, And*ln as to the land which You gave to our fathers to eat of its fruit and its bounty, Behold,*ln we are slaves in it.
Its*ln abundant produce is for the kings Whom*ln You have set over us because of our sins; They*ln also rule over our bodies And*ln over our cattle as they please, So*ln we are in great distress.
A Covenant Results
“Now*pn because of all this We*ln are making an agreement in writing; And*ln on the sealed document are*i the*i names*i of*i our leaders, our Levites and*i our priests.”
